structure.unit: ADMINISTRATION OF TRUSTS -- LEGAL INVESTMENTS -- UNIFORM PRINCIPAL AND INCOME ACT

law.catch_line: Receipts from minerals, water, and other natural resources.

text.section: An amount received on account of an interest in water that is renewable shall be allocated to income. If the water is not renewable, ninety percent (90%) of the amount shall be allocated to principal and the balance to income.
KRS 386.450 to 386.504 apply whether or not a decedent or donor was extracting minerals, water, or other natural resources before the interest became subject to the trust.

If a trust owns an interest in minerals, water, or other natural resources on January 1, 2005, the trustee may allocate receipts from the interest as provided in KRS 386.450 to 386.504 or in the manner used by the trustee before January 1, 2005. If the trust acquires an interest in minerals, water, or other natural resources after January 1, 2005, the trustee shall allocate receipts from the interest as provided in KRS 386.450 to 386.504.
The proceeds from any disposition of an interest specified in this section shall be allocated in the same manner as receipts from the interest.

law.history: Created 2004 Ky. Acts ch. 158, sec. 18, effective January 1, 2005.
